adjective.description: Lizard-like; (Zoology) lacertiform, lacertilian, lacertid. Now rare in zoological use.
Of a decoration, motif, pattern, etc.: consisting of or incorporating interlaced lizard-like figures.

noun.description: Zoology. A lizard; specifically a lacertid or lacertoid lizard. Now rare.
A lizard-like figure interlaced with others to form a decoration or motif. Usually in plural.

origin: Early 19th century. From classical Latin lacerta lizard + -ine.
